rooms.Name: The Premise
rooms.Description:
On 21st October of 1994, three student film makers, Heather Donahue, Joshua
Leonard and Michael Williams hiked into Maryland's Black Hills Forest to 
film a documentary on a local legend. The Blair Witch. They were never heard
from again..........       One year later, their footage was found.
                                        o
                                        o
                                        o
                              ooooooooooooooooooooo
                                    o   o   o
                                     o  o  o
                                      o o o
                                       ooo
                                        o
                                       o o
                                      o   o
                                     o     o
                                    o       o
                                   o         o
                                  o           o

rooms.Name: The highway into the village of Burkittsville
rooms.Description:
February 1785
   Several children accuse Elly Kedward of luring them
        into her Blair home to draw blood from them.
   Kedward is found guilty of witchcraft, banished from
     the village during a particularly harsh winter and
                  presumed dead.

rooms.Name: The highway into the village of Burkittsville
rooms.Description:
November 1786
  By midwinter all of Kedward's accusers along with half
            of the town's children vanish.
   Fearing a curse, the townspeople flee Blair and vow
       never to utter Elly Kedward's name again.

rooms.Name: The highway into the village of Burkittsville
rooms.Description:
November 1801
     The Blair Witch Cult is published. This rare book,
   commonly considered fiction, tells of an entire town
             cursed by an outcast witch.

rooms.Name: The highway into the village of Burkittsville
rooms.Description:
August 1825
    Eleven witnesses testify to seeing a pale woman's
  hand reach up and pull ten-year-old Eileen Treacle into
                 Tappy East Creek.
    Her body is never recovered, and for thirteen days
     after the drowning the creek is clogged with oily
                 bundles of sticks.

rooms.Name: The small village of Burkittsville, MD
rooms.Description:
________________________________________________
     Welcome to the Village of Burkittsville, MD
     ________________________________________________
                        1824
      The Village of Burkittsville is founded on the
                   old Blair site.

rooms.Name: The small village of Burkittsville, MD
rooms.Description:
Most of the people in this quiet little town seem reluctant
  to speak or claim not to have heard about any of the long list
  of strange events that have occurred in this area.  Some even
  deny them all together.  But legend tells a different story.

rooms.Name: The small village of Burkittsville, MD
rooms.Description:
March 1886
   Eight-year-old Robin Weaver is reported missing and
     search parties are dispatched. Although Weaver
      returns, one of the search parties does not.
  Their bodies are found weeks later at Coffin Rock tied
          together at the arms and legs and
              completely disemboweled.

rooms.Name: Black Rock Road
rooms.Description:
Black Rock Road is a narrow, winding, paved road.  Shrouded in
a canopy of trees along its edge, the path is dim and the
visibility is poor.  The road leads into the heart of the Black
Hills Forest, the source of many myths and legends.

rooms.Name: Black Rock Road
rooms.Description:
Black Rock Road is a narrow, winding, paved road.  Shrouded in
a canopy of trees along its edge, the path is dim and the
visibility is poor.  The road leads into the heart of the Black
Hills Forest, the source of many myths and legends.

rooms.Description:

a canopy of trees along its edge, the path is dim and the
visibility is poor.  The road leads into the heart of the Black
Hills Forest, the source of many myths and legends.

rooms.Name: On the waters edge of Tappy Creek
rooms.Description:
This area is popular with local fisherman and the site of several
ghost sightings.  But after a few hours of drinking, err fishing,
who knows what is fact and what is fiction in the tales spun by
the local sportsmen.

Exits.Description: The stream is oily and full of debris.

rooms.Name: Tappy Creek
rooms.Description:
Tappy East Creek, this is the same section of the creek where Eileen
Treacle disappeared. The oily bundles of sticks that appeared for weeks
afterward made the water undrinkable. Mary Brown claims to have seen 
the Blair Witch one day near Tappy Creek in the form of a hairy, 
half-human, half-animal beast.

rooms.Name: Tappy Creek
rooms.Description:
Tappy East Creek, this is the same section of the creek where Eileen
Treacle disappeared. The oily bundles of sticks that appeared for weeks
afterward made the water undrinkable. Mary Brown claims to have seen 
the Blair Witch one day near Tappy Creek in the form of a hairy, 
half-human, half-animal beast.

rooms.Name: Tappy Creek
rooms.Description:
Tappy East Creek, this is the same section of the creek where Eileen
Treacle disappeared. The oily bundles of sticks that appeared for weeks
afterward made the water undrinkable. Mary Brown claims to have seen 
the Blair Witch one day near Tappy Creek in the form of a hairy, 
half-human, half-animal beast.

rooms.Name: Tappy Creek
rooms.Description:
Tappy East Creek, this is the same section of the creek where Eileen
Treacle disappeared. The oily bundles of sticks that appeared for weeks
afterward made the water undrinkable. Mary Brown claims to have seen 
the Blair Witch one day near Tappy Creek in the form of a hairy, 
half-human, half-animal beast.

Exits.Description: The legendary spirit is hovering above the water gazing into your soul.

rooms.Name: Tappy Creek
rooms.Description:
Tappy East Creek, this is the same section of the creek where Eileen
Treacle disappeared. The oily bundles of sticks that appeared for weeks
afterward made the water undrinkable. Mary Brown claims to have seen 
the Blair Witch one day near Tappy Creek in the form of a hairy, 
half-human, half-animal beast.

a canopy of trees along its edge, the path is dim and the
visibility is poor.  The road leads into the heart of the Black

Exits.Description: The barn is old and run down.  It doesn't look safe at all.

rooms.Name: Inside an old abandoned barn
rooms.Description:
There is barely enough light in the barn to make out anything too
clearly.  In the darkness you can just make out a transparent figure.

rooms.Name: Black Rock Road
rooms.Description:
Black Rock Road is a narrow, winding, paved road.  Shrouded in
a canopy of trees along its edge, the path is dim and the
visibility is poor.  The road leads into the heart of the Black
Hills Forest, the source of many myths and legends.

a canopy of trees along its edge, the path is dim and the
visibility is poor.  The road leads into the heart of the Black
Hills Forest, the source of many myths and legends.

rooms.Name: The roads edge
rooms.Description:
An area just large enough to park a car is beside the road here.
This is where the old logging trail meets up with the pavement.
                   October 25 1994
   The first APB is issued. Josh's car is found later in the
           day parked on Black Rock Road.

rooms.Name: The beginning of an old logging trail
rooms.Description:
The woods seem deserted and peaceful.  The old logging trail is overgrown
and appears little used.

Exits.Description: The trail looks overgrown and scarcely used.  This really a trail?

rooms.Name: An old logging trail in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
According to Heather's map everything is going according to plan and
Coffin Rock is just ahead.  A great place to get some video footage
and add some drama to the groups project.  The woods seem deserted and
peaceful.  The old logging trail is overgrown and appears little used.

rooms.Name: An old logging trail in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
According to Heather's map everything is going according to plan and
Coffin Rock is just ahead.  A great place to get some video footage
and add some drama to the groups project.  The woods seem deserted and
peaceful.  The old logging trail is overgrown and appears little used.

rooms.Name: An old logging trail in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
According to Heather's map everything is going according to plan and
Coffin Rock is just ahead.  A great place to get some video footage
and add some drama to the groups project.  The woods seem deserted and
peaceful.  The old logging trail is overgrown and appears little used.

rooms.Name: Coffin Rock
rooms.Description:
This is the site where five men, who were searching for the
missing Robin Weaver, were found with their bodies tied 
together at the arms and legs. Each had been disemboweled 
and were in an advanced state of decomposition. Strange 
markings had been carved into their faces and hands.

rooms.Name: The Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
The Black Hills Forest is peaceful and deserted in the day.  But, at
night, for a few days every fifty years, these woods come alive with
a thirst for young blood.  Unrecognizeable, disturbing noises are
coming from all directions in the darkness.

rooms.Name: The Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
The Black Hills Forest is peaceful and deserted in the day.  But, at
night, for a few days every fifty years, these woods come alive with
a thirst for young blood.  Unrecognizeable, disturbing noises are
coming from all directions in the darkness.

rooms.Name: The Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
Legend has it that the old Blair Cemetary is around here somewhere in
the Black Hills Forest.  It was abandoned along with the town of Blair
in the early 1800s.  It can't be more than an hour up ahead.  No, wait.
Two hours tops.  Three or four hours at the outside.  However long it
takes, It'll be worth it just for a look.

rooms.Name: The Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
Legend has it that the old Blair Cemetary is around here somewhere in
the Black Hills Forest.  It was abandoned along with the town of Blair
in the early 1800s.  It can't be more than an hour up ahead.  No, wait.
Two hours tops.  Three or four hours at the outside.  However long it
takes, It'll be worth it just for a look.

rooms.Name: A clearing in the forest
rooms.Description:
Here in the center of the clearing is a tree with stones tied to it.
There are seven piles of stones on the ground arranged in a strange
pattern.  To disturb one of these piles of stones would mark you as
a dead man.  A good place to camp for the night?  Hardly.
What first appears to be an old cemetary turns out not to be
at all.

rooms.Name: The Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
The Black Hills Forest is peaceful and deserted in the day.  But, at
night, for a few days every fifty years, these woods come alive with
a thirst for young blood.  Unrecognizeable, disturbing noises are
coming from all directions in the darkness.

rooms.Name: The Nightmare begins
rooms.Description:
It would definitely be a good idea to exit these woods as soon as
possible.  Although leaving won't be quite as painless as entering.
You held your own fate in your hands outside these woods but here,
on the inside, your fate is out of your control.  The spirits have
awakened and it's your blood they crave.  One pile of stones has
appeared here on the ground, put there by persons unknown, for each 
member of your group.

rooms.Name: Lost in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
The deeper you get into these woods the more everything starts to look
the same.  And, as nightfall closes in, you begin to lose all sense of time
and direction.  Although you came here to learn more about the legend
of the Blair Witch, the next chapter in the legend is unfolding with
you center stage.  You are deperately lost in the woods, stalked by unseen
forces, and noone is going to help you. You failed to recognize the signs.
You failed to heed the warnings.
"I'm scared to close my eyes ... I'm scared to open them."
                                              Heather Donahue

rooms.Name: Lost in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
"Okay, here's your motivation.  You're lost.  You're angry in the woods.
And no one here is here to help you.  There's a witch and she keeps leaving
shit outside your door.  There's no one here to help you.  She left little
trinkets.  You took one of them.  She ran after us.  There's no one here 
to help you.  We walked for fifteen hours today.  We ended up in the same 
place.  There's no one here to help you.  That's your motivation!"
                                                      Joshua Leonard

rooms.Name: Lost in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
"Okay, here's your motivation.  You're lost.  You're angry in the woods.
And no one here is here to help you.  There's a witch and she keeps leaving
shit outside your door.  There's no one here to help you.  She left little
trinkets.  You took one of them.  She ran after us.  There's no one here 
to help you.  We walked for fifteen hours today.  We ended up in the same 
place.  There's no one here to help you.  That's your motivation!"
                                                      Joshua Leonard

rooms.Name: The Twana Garden
rooms.Description:
It is said that the figures hanging in the trees in the forest represent 
spirits of the dead being able to travel between earth and the spirit world.
The trees, with their roots in the earth and branches up in the air, serve 
as bridges between the earth and spirit world. When the stick men are hung 
in a tree they provide a way for the spirit to travel between worlds. When 
a figure is removed it traps the spirit in one of the worlds..............
The Twana stickmen are rife with power.

rooms.Name: Lost in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
"Okay, here's your motivation.  You're lost.  You're angry in the woods.
And no one here is here to help you.  There's a witch and she keeps leaving
shit outside your door.  There's no one here to help you.  She left little

                                                      Joshua Leonard

                                                      Joshua Leonard

rooms.Name: A Glimmer of hope
rooms.Description:
A mysterious, agonizing voice is calling you nearer to an old house
here in the middle of nowhere.  Could there be someone home there to
help?  The familiar voice cuts through the night like a blade in your
back.

rooms.Name: Outside Rustin Parr's house
rooms.Description:
Here, defying all logic of space and time, stands the house of
Rustin Parr.  As an adult Rustin decided to build a house in the 
hills, a beautiful, three-story home next to a creek, a four-hour
walk from town. When his aunt died and his uncle moved to Baltimore, 
Rustin lived in the house alone. He often took long walks in the 
woods. He only went into town about twice a year to pick up supplies.
The home was burned down in 1941 by the towns people of 
Burkittsville.

rooms.Name: Inside the Parr House
rooms.Description:
Inside the house, the familiar voice is calling to you for help.
The person sounds in terrifying pain and the sound seems to be coming
from every room.  The battered walls are covered with strange,
unrecognizeable symbols.  Along the lower part of the walls, are the
bloody handprints of small children.

rooms.Name: Inside the Parr House
rooms.Description:
Inside the house, the familiar voice is calling to you for help.
The person sounds in terrifying pain and the sound seems to be coming
from every room.  The battered walls are covered with strange,
unrecognizeable symbols.  Along the lower part of the walls, are the
bloody handprints of small children.

rooms.Name: Inside the Parr House
rooms.Description:
Inside the house, the familiar voice is calling to you for help.
The person sounds in terrifying pain and the sound seems to be coming
from every room.  The battered walls are covered with strange,
unrecognizeable symbols.  Along the lower part of the walls, are the
bloody handprints of small children.

rooms.Name: The basement (The Nightmare ends)
rooms.Description:
Here in the Parr Cellar is where unspeakable acts of horror occurred.
Rustin murdered seven children and buried them in this cellar while 
under the control of the Blair Witch. The one child that was spared,
Kyle Brody, was made to stand in the corner while Rustin performed 
the awful act.

rooms.Name: The small village of Burkittsville, MD
rooms.Description:
November 1940 - May 1941
                        
   Starting with Emily Hollands, a total of seven children
        are abducted from the area surrounding
               Burkittsville, Maryland.

rooms.Name: Outside the home of Mary Brown
rooms.Description:
Who can withstand his indignation? Who can endure his fierce anger? His wrath
is poured out like fire, the rocks are shattered before him. The LORD said,
"Go out and stand on the mountain in the presence of the LORD, for the LORD
is about to pass by." Then a great and powerful wind tore the mountains apart
and shattered the rocks before the LORD, but the LORD was not in the wind.
After the wind there was an earthquake, but the LORD was not in the
earthquake.

rooms.Name: The small village of Burkittsville, MD
rooms.Description:
May 25 1941
    An old hermit named Rustin Parr walks into a local
       market and tells the people there that he is
                  "finally finished."

rooms.Name: The Burkittsville cemetary
rooms.Description:
No more than twenty families laid their roots in Blair over
200 years ago.  Many of whom remain, either in this cemetary
or in the town below.  There are an unusually high number of
children laid to rest here.  Most of whom past in the 1940s.
Yet, no one in the town seems to recall anything unusual about
this time.  Legend tells a different story.  One whose
evidence is all around you, etched in stone.

rooms.Name: Lost in the Black Hills Forest
rooms.Description:
"Okay, here's your motivation.  You're lost.  You're angry in the woods.
And no one here is here to help you.  There's a witch and she keeps leaving
shit outside your door.  There's no one here to help you.  She left little
trinkets.  You took one of them.  She ran after us.  There's no one here 
to help you.  We walked for fifteen hours today.  We ended up in the same 
place.  There's no one here to help you.  That's your motivation!"
                                                      Joshua Leonard

rooms.Name: The Burkittsville Post Office
rooms.Description:
October 26 1994
 The Maryland State Police launch their search of the
   Black Hills area, an operation that lasts ten days and
     includes up to one hundred men aided by dogs,
   helicopters, and even a fly over by a Department of
                 Defense satellite.
